etymology.description: 镬(鑊) (huò, "pot") + 囧(囧) (jiǒng, "eye") — the pot resembles the shape of an eye as its main form.
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the visual aspect of a pot with the phonetic element resembling an eye. The eye contributes to the sound while the pot's shape evokes the idea of a cooking vessel.

examples.chinese: 这个字常用于文言文，尤其在古代文化中(這個字常用於文言文，尤其在古代文化中)。
examples.pinyin: zhè ge zì cháng yòng yú wényánwén, yóuqí zài gǔdài wénhuà zhōng。
examples.english: This character is often used in Classical Chinese, particularly in ancient literature.

examples.chinese: 在古籍中，镬被频繁提及(在古籍中，鑊被頻繁提及)。
examples.pinyin: zài gǔjí zhōng, huò bèi pínfán tíqí。
examples.english: In ancient texts, pots are frequently mentioned.
